headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; The Government Agent to Frazer's River-The Policy to be pursued Towards Miners from the States-Note from Lord Malmesbary-Extra Compensation to Clerks, &c. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. NUGENT leaves on the steamer with instructions from the State Department, to proceed to the Fraser River country and closely observe the current, and report the same to the Government here. He is to give every assurance to our people now pouring into that country, that their rights will be cared for and protected, if they, on their part, strictly abstain from all violence and disorder.

headline.main: COLLEGE COMMENCEMENTS.; Laying the Corner-Stone of Graduates" Hall -Speeches of Judge Harris and Dr. Nott--Commencent Exercises-The Orations and the Graduates. UNION COLLEGE.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.-----The Board met on Friday, at the usual hour and place; present, the mayor, President HASWELL and Doctors THOMPSON and MILLER. The Captain of the brig Proteus, from Sagna la Grande July 11, asked for permission to come to...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.-----The Board met on Friday, at the usual hour and place; present, the mayor, President HASWELL and Doctors THOMPSON and MILLER. The Captain of the brig Proteus, from Sagna la Grande July 11, asked for permission to come to the upper Quarantine. It was decided to allow her to come up on the 3d of August.

docs.abstract: Examination of Frank Leslie on a charge of Libel
docs.lead_paragraph: THE SWILL-MILK INVESTIGATION-THE LIBEL SUIT AGAINST FRANK LESLIE.-An examination took place yesterday at 3 P. M., before Justice QUACERNBUSH, at the Jefferson Market Police Court, in the case of the libel suit instituted by Alderman REED, against FRANK LESLIE, for the publication of a woodcut which appeared in one of the late numbers of FRANK LESLIE'S paper.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM NICARAGUA.; THE STEBBINS CONTRACT INTACT. Arrival of General Jerez as Minister Plenipotentiary. Return of Webster and Allen Without the Transit Grant. RATIFICATION OF THE CASS-YRISSARI TREATY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamer Granada, Lieut. BERRYMAN Commanding, arrived from Aspinwall late on Thursday afternoon, having sailed on the 19th inst. via Greytown on the 20th, and touching at Key West on the 25th. Among her passengers, of whom there were only ten or twelve, are Messrs. WEBSTER and ALLEN, accompanied by Mr. GOTTEL, the agents of Commodore VANDERBILT to Nicaragua; General MAXIMO JEREZ,

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; The New ?? Gold/Digging.--Offer of the Hadaon's Bay Company to Self their Property in the United States--Increased Treasury Receipts, & c. INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Government is perfectly satisfied that steps taken by Great Briltain will prevent any collision or misunderstanding between the miners and the Government authorities at the newly-discovered gold-diggings in "New-Caledonia." docs.snippet: Forty-one vessels, of various description, arriving from ports characterized as infected with yellow fever, are now lying at the Lower Bay of this City, and nearly the same number are undergoing Quarantine at the upper anchorage. The ship...
docs.lead_paragraph: Forty-one vessels, of various description, arriving from ports characterized as infected with yellow fever, are now lying at the Lower Bay of this City, and nearly the same number are undergoing Quarantine at the upper anchorage. The ship Competition, from Havaia, Key-West, came into port on the 26th in ballast, having no sickness on board.

headline.main: LETTERS FROM WATERING-PLACES.; The Season a ??--Unexpected Rush of Visitors--Remarkable Effects of the Water-Ger. Wool, Gov. Bouck, Rev. John ?? and other ?? Prayer ?? Brooklyn A intocrais,&c.,&c.

docs.lead_paragraph: When I left the hot and dusty streets of new-York, I had not a issed any body--but, to my great surprise, I find everybody and his wife enjoying themselves here in Saratoga, lounging on the grand piazzas of the hotels, clustering like bees about the well-room of Congress Spring, and Living to the Lake.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE PRIZE FIGHT BETWEEN MORRISSEY AND HERNAN.-If the people of Canade permit their soil to be disgraced by the brutal exhibition-the terms of which are set forth below-they will deserve the obloquy which it will bring upon them. The following is from Porter's Spirit, for this week: "In our last we announced the definite settlement of the great match for the championship, between JOHN HERNAN (the Benicia Boy) and JOHN MORRISSEY.
